intro: Daucus capillifolius, commonly known as the slenderleaf parsley or sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shorelines, where it thrives in saline and well-drained conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Daucus capillifolius is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
